H4IIE cells that had been pre-treated with licorice for 12 h were further incubated with licorice + As (400 M) for another 12 h. the cells were lysed and the total cell lysate was applied to cleaved caspase-3 sandwich ELISA kit. liquiritin, liquiritigenin, isoliquiritigenin, liquiritigenin, glycyrrhizin and glycyrrhizic acid are the major constituents. licorice and liquiritigenin prevented Cd-induced apoptosis, and non-apoptotic cell death, irrespective of sulfhydryl deficiency. licorice prevented Cd-induced toxicity in H4IIE cells (3). licorice significantly inhibited apoptosis at lower concentration or necrosis at high concentration in mouse embryonic fibroblasts. licorice inhibited caspase-3 activation (Fig. 6) and reduced the population of apoptotic cells. caspase-3 activation was inhibited by both 0.1 and 1.0 mg ml1 of licorice. net cell viability by 1.0 mg ml1 of licorice was much higher than that by 0.1 mg ml1 of licorice.
